column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: cause. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```@prefix : <http://www.example.org/ontology/cause#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Cause a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Cause"@en ;    rdfs:comment "A thing that gives rise to an action, phenomenon, condition, or state"@en .:CauseEffect a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Cause Effect"@en ;    rdfs:comment "An effect produced by a cause"@en ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Cause .:Agent a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Agent"@en ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that causes a change in state or a process to occur"@en .:Result a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Result"@en ;    rdfs:comment "The outcome or effect produced by a cause"@en ;    rdfs:subClassOf :CauseEffect .:causedBy a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "caused by"@en ;    rdfs:domain :Result ;    rdfs:range :Agent ;    rdfs:comment "A relation between a result and its cause"@en .:hasEffect a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has effect"@en ;    rdfs:range :CauseEffect ;    rdfs:domain :Agent ;    rdfs:inverseOf :causedBy ;    rdfs:comment "A relation describing the effect an agent has"@en .:hasCause a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has cause"@en ;    rdfs:range :Cause ;    rdfs:domain :Result ;    rdfs:inverseOf :hasEffect ;    rdfs:comment "A relation describing the cause of a result"@en .```
